newsitem.title: USA: General Scanning says wins favorble ruling.
newsitem.headline: General Scanning says wins favorble ruling.

text.p: General Scanning Inc said Tuesday an appeals court affirmed a lower court's decision in favor of its View Engineering Inc division in a patent dispute against Robotic Vision Systems Inc.
The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit decision involved a suit seeking declaratory relief that a single patent on which Robotic had threatened suit was not infringed and invalid.
Robotic counterclaimed for alleged trade libel and infringement of eight patents.

View said that after it challenged the merits of Robotic's case, Robotic dropped its infringement claims involving five of the patents and did not pursue the claim for trade libel. View said that in June 1996, prior to its merger with General Scanning, the District Court issued a summary judgment ruling in its favor with respect to the remaining three patents and also awarded it attorneys fees.
Two other patent infringement suits filed by Robotic against View remain pending.
In a separate statement, Robotic said the other patent suits are not effected by this latest ruling.
